name: Moses
blurb: Rescued from the Nile by Pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to Midian after defending a Hebrew. At the burning bush he meets the God of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confront
searchText: moses person narrative rescued from the nile by pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to midian after defending a hebrew. at the burning bush he meets the god of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confronts pharaoh with signs and speeches, leads through the plagues, and brings israel to the sea. moses’ story in these chapters showcases divine compassion, judgment, and the birth of a nation.

name: prophets
searchText: prophets group office

name: Aaron
blurb: Moses’ brother and spokesman, later high priest. Performs signs before Pharaoh, stretches the staff over Egypt and the sea, and leads in worship.
searchText: aaron person narrative moses’ brother and spokesman, later high priest. performs signs before pharaoh, stretches the staff over egypt and the sea, and leads in worship.

name: Abraham
searchText: abraham person patriarch

name: Angels
blurb: Ministering beings who serve, separate, and announce—agents of divine governance and revelation.
searchText: angels group heavenly-host ministering beings who serve, separate, and announce—agents of divine governance and revelation.

name: Noah
blurb: Noah ‘walked with God’ in a corrupt generation. Obedient to God’s word, he builds the ark and becomes the instrument of preservation through the Flood. Afterward, God covenants never again to destroy
searchText: noah person narrative noah ‘walked with god’ in a corrupt generation. obedient to god’s word, he builds the ark and becomes the instrument of preservation through the flood. afterward, god covenants never again to destroy the earth with water, giving the rainbow as a sign. jewish tradition debates whether noah’s righteousness was relative or absolute; christian readers see in him a type of christ—obedient, saving his household. p.noah.daughter-of-zelophehad--9d853482

name: Isaac
blurb: The son of promise, Isaac embodies God’s fidelity to His word. Spared on Moriah (Gen 22), he receives Abraham’s covenant and becomes father to Esau and Jacob. Isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal,
searchText: isaac person narrative the son of promise, isaac embodies god’s fidelity to his word. spared on moriah (gen 22), he receives abraham’s covenant and becomes father to esau and jacob. isaac’s narrative is quieter yet pivotal, showing god’s promise advancing through ordinary life and tested faith. p.isaac--3af10add p.isaac.gene-26--da8ff3bc

name: Sarah
searchText: sarah person allegory

name: Abel
blurb: Abel offers the firstborn of his flock and is regarded by God. Murdered by Cain, he becomes Scripture’s first martyr. His blood cries for justice, while Christ’s blood speaks a better word of mercy.
searchText: abel person narrative abel offers the firstborn of his flock and is regarded by god. murdered by cain, he becomes scripture’s first martyr. his blood cries for justice, while christ’s blood speaks a better word of mercy.

name: David
blurb: Anointed in obscurity, musician and warrior. His God-centered courage fells Goliath; his restraint toward Saul models kingship under God.
searchText: david person narrative anointed in obscurity, musician and warrior. his god-centered courage fells goliath; his restraint toward saul models kingship under god.

name: Joseph
blurb: Beloved son whose later story dominates Gen 37–50; in 26–36 he is born and becomes a source of family tension.

name: Samson
blurb: Nazarite from the womb whose strength exposes Philistine pretensions. He is a bundle of contradictions—set apart yet impulsive, mighty yet morally fragile. In death he brings the house down on Dagon’s
searchText: samson person narrative nazarite from the womb whose strength exposes philistine pretensions. he is a bundle of contradictions—set apart yet impulsive, mighty yet morally fragile. in death he brings the house down on dagon’s worshipers, a final act of faith that shines through the wreckage.

name: Samuel
blurb: Miracle child turned reformer-prophet. He hears God, gathers Israel to repentance, anoints kings, and insists that obedience outranks sacrifice.
searchText: samuel person narrative miracle child turned reformer-prophet. he hears god, gathers israel to repentance, anoints kings, and insists that obedience outranks sacrifice.
